localization with circles

Localization using four wireless beacons

  • Move mouse to simulate distance from beacons.
  • Click and hold to show node intersections and location guess.
  • Use 'up' key to toggle simulated jitter (randomized variation in sensor readings).
  • Use 'down' key to toggle a constant 'offset', indicating badly calibrated beacons.
  • Red nodes are 'trusted', and are used for location guessing.
  • Size of green circle during jitter indicates one standard deviation.
